thoughts: Goes out to ponder over a new prophesy
Purposefully made their prophesy report hard to follow, just to make it an adventure
Purposefully made their omen seem more cryptic, just to make it an adventure
Is exploring unclaimed lands to find out more about their ancestor's ways
Went to sleep with hopes of discovering a new prophesy
Thinks about visiting StarClan, just to explore their hunting grounds
Hopes that they will be part of a major prophesy soon
Hopes that their chosen apprentice will be interested in clan history
Is showing the kits StarClan's power by taking them on adventures in the territory
Helps the leader with their duties while the deputy is on patrol
Offers to help the queens with badger rides for the kits
Considers making up a prophesy as a high-tale for the kits
Insists on taking on more tasks
Spends all day trying to form a deeper bond with StarClan
Can't wait until StarClan sends an omen
Is part of a major prophesy, but not in the way some weak cats would hope.
Has been disappearing a lot lately
Insists that they don't need to explain their actions as a Starteller
Is ripping some leaves to shreds
Debates whether a prophesy is including weak cats or not
Gives a biased omen to the leader on purpose
Wishes {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/weren't/wasn't} confined to this life
Is attempting to hide an omen
Is attempting to hide a prophesy
Is attempting to chase off a wandering spirit with good intentions
Is ignoring a prophesy relating to a clanmate's death
Tells the kits terrifying stories of fake omens

Wishes to fight alongside the warriors
Thinks {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}'d be an amazing leader
Talks to the leader and deputy about war

Decides to see if {PRONOUNS/m_c/subject} can fix a problem without consulting the leader
Wants to tell someone that they'll die soon, according to an omen
Stays composed when hearing of a deadly prophesy
Keeps calm as the leader panics about a new prophesy

Helps calm down a nervous queen
Contemplates a new prophesy carefully
Makes sure that the leader is aware of any omens recently
Is talking with the elders about recent good omens
Refuses to be 'solemn' and 'detached' from the clan
Tells a high-tale of an ancient prophesy to a kit
Bounces excitedly at the half-moon meeting
Is confused by a new omen
Can't understand why StarClan would take any cats at all
Watches the stars with childish glee
Plays with some wind-swept catmint
Grumbles as a warrior asks if there's been any bad omens recently
Is completely unfazed as a brutal prophesy plays out before them in a dream
Stays completely neutral as the leader worries over a new omen, seeming not to care

Visits StarClan purely to comfort recently lost cats

Declines to eat when prey is low
Listens to the apprentices complain about their training with a deep fondness
Is proud of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} ability to understand omens
Is confident as a Starteller
Is certain that they completely understand StarClan
Believes that they don't need an apprentice
Does not doubt {PRONOUN/m_c/self} while talking to the leader about a new prophesy
Outwardly tells the clan of a new prophesy, with no hesitance
Goes out into the wilderness alone to become closer with StarClan
Has been hearing the voices of StarClan cats much clearer recently
Has full faith in StarClan, no matter what
Wonders if StarClan has plans for them
Tells the leader of a new prophesy immediately after hearing of it
Insists on joining battle training once a moon
Insists on taking immediate action to an unclear omen
